programme.title: L'avenir nous appartient
programme.desc: Episode 6 Ghyslain Vallière wants to educate prostitutes' customers through a John School; Nathalie Miller is training business owners in leadership skills. Ravy Por offers companies support to help them establish their own ethics charter for processing of personal data. Le Semoir trains young ecocitizens. Directed by: Jean-François Poisson (Canada, 2021)

programme.title: Le vrai nouveau monde
programme.desc:
Leaving those you love Originally from Vietnam, Zoonie Nguyen found refuge in Quebec in 1975, with her family. An epic journey that was almost a miracle. In Montérégie, Gregory Charles meets Valentin Ramirez, a seasonal worker born in Mexico, who dreams of settling in the region with his wife and children.

Directed by: Sophie Lambert (Canada, 2019) With Gregory Charles

programme.title: Destinations
programme.desc: Sète, a maritime cradle for Paul Valéry A narrow strip of land between the Mediterranean and the Étang de Thau, the town of Sète was the birthplace of Paul Valéry. Its historical districts, crossed by colourful canals and its narrow streets justly earned it the name of the Venice of Languedoc.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: The curious tale of the customized lobster An immersive film that recounts the tortuous route taken to arrive at the point of revolutionising marine taxidermy. Backed by the owner of one of the most important collections of curiosities in the world, William Dubourg, taxidermist from Caen, is about to create customized crustaceans mounted in exploded format. Documentary by: Jackie Maugère. Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
Are we alone in the universe?
Are there other life forms in the universe? How do scientists search for signs of life on other planets? Where does the myth of flying saucers come from and what do the messages sent out into space say? Jamy and his colleagues have kept their feet firmly on the ground here on Earth, for a programme that's distinctly alien!
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: Quand l'histoire fait dates
programme.desc:
315, the Donation of Constantine/29 May 1453, the capture of Constantinople
The Donation of Constantine, one of the most influential mediaeval texts, legitimised the Popes' temporal power. In 1440, it was refuted by the humanist Lorenzo Valla. In 1453, the capture of Constantinople marked the fall of the Byzantine Empire, and the end of any understanding between East and West.
Directed by: Denis Van Waerebeke, Benoît Laborde (France, 2019)

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
Are we alone in the universe?
Are there other life forms in the universe? How do scientists search for signs of life on other planets? Where does the myth of flying saucers come from and what do the messages sent out into space say? Jamy and his colleagues have kept their feet firmly on the ground here on Earth, for a programme that's distinctly alien!
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: The curious tale of the customized lobster An immersive film that recounts the tortuous route taken to arrive at the point of revolutionising marine taxidermy. Backed by the owner of one of the most important collections of curiosities in the world, William Dubourg, taxidermist from Caen, is about to create customized crustaceans mounted in exploded format. Documentary by: Jackie Maugère. Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Rocky & Lily : c'est dans la boîte !
programme.desc:
The space bun trend
Today, the programme is all about hairstyles. Space buns, Mohawk, sushi or spag bog: Rocky and Lily and feeling very inspired!
Directed by: Angelo Abou Hatem (season 2, Belgium, 2021) With Aurélie Martinez and Romain Angeveld

programme.title: Échappées belles
programme.desc: Zanzibar and Tanzania Each year Tanzania attracts innumerable visitors. Its national parks, notably the Serengeti and the Ngorongoro Crater, offer some of the most highly-reputed safaris in Africa. In 2016, Kilimanjaro was voted the best African tourist attraction. Zanzibar's beaches and cultural heritage draw all those with an inquisitive nature. Presented by: Jérôme Pitorin. Directed by: Erwan Loussot (season 15, France, 2021)

programme.title: Le club Vinland
programme.desc:
Quebec at the end of the 1940s. In a boys' secondary school, charismatic Brother Jean wants to simultaneously solve a historical puzzle, motivate his class and prevent Émile, a pupil in difficulty, from dropping out. The archaeological dig he begins with them will profoundly mark the life of the school...

Directed by: Benoît Pilon (Canada, 2020)

Cast: Sébastien Ricard, Arnaud Vachon, Émilie Bibeau

Genre: Drama

programme.title: Faits divers
programme.desc:
Episode 1: On the eve of the carnage

A muddy field, a man and woman lying on the ground, murdered. Constance Forest, investigator with the Mascouche regional police is certain that there would have been a third victim, Nancy Lebeau-Pratt. Who is responsible for the carnage? The clues point to Mike Pratt, husband of one of the victims...

Directed by: Stéphane Lapointe (season 1, Canada, 2017)

Screenplay: Joanne Arseneau

Cast: Isabelle Blais (Constance Forest), Fred-Éric Salvail (Antoine Chevrier-Marseau), Émile Proulx-Cloutier (Frédérik Bérubé), Maxime Mailloux (Jonas), Fabien Cloutier (Mike Pratt), Mylène Mackay (Marlène Charbonneau), David Boutin (Éric Charbonneau), Marie-Ève Beaulieu (Anne Dupuis), Patrick Hivon (Sylvain Lauzon), Alexa-Jeanne Dubé (Zoé Forest), Francis LaHaye (Joël Savard), Guy Nadon (Serge Forest)

Genre: thriller

Awards: best performance by an actor in a leading role in a dramatic series (Fabien Cloutier) at the 2018 Gémeaux Parental guidance: not recommended for children under the age of 10 (-10)

programme.title: Faits divers
programme.desc:
Episode 2: The hours before the explosion

Will Rodrigue Rancourt agree to give Mike an alibi? There's still no sign of Joël Savard. The investigators search his caravan and discover incriminating evidence. The bomb threatens to go off at any moment. Mike learns that Joël Savard is the prime suspect in his wife's death.

Directed by: Stéphane Lapointe (season 1, Canada, 2017)

Screenplay: Joanne Arseneau

Cast: Isabelle Blais (Constance Forest), Fred-Éric Salvail (Antoine Chevrier-Marseau), Émile Proulx-Cloutier (Frédérik Bérubé), Maxime Mailloux (Jonas), Fabien Cloutier (Mike Pratt), Mylène Mackay (Marlène Charbonneau), David Boutin (Éric Charbonneau), Marie-Ève Beaulieu (Anne Dupuis), Patrick Hivon (Sylvain Lauzon), Alexa-Jeanne Dubé (Zoé Forest), Francis LaHaye (Joël Savard), Guy Nadon (Serge Forest)

Genre: thriller

Awards: best performance by an actor in a leading role in a dramatic series (Fabien Cloutier) at the 2018 Gémeaux

Parental guidance: not recommended for children under the age of 10 (-10)

programme.title: Quand l'histoire fait dates
programme.desc:
The Revolutions of 1848/October 1860, sack of the Summer Palace in Beijing
1848 isn't so much a date as a vintage, a year that concerned the whole of Europe, laying the foundations of its political modernity. October 1860, English and French troops pillaged and destroyed Qing Xianfeng's summer palace: the Yuánmíng Yuán. The episode marked the climax of the Second Opium War.
Directed by: Pascal Goblot, Juliette Garcias (France, 2019-220)
